results.title: Amy is a tiger
results.creator_credit: Keith Hall and Cameracraft Film Productions
results.brief_description: A promotional film for industrial development in Queensland. A Canadian, visiting Queensland to report on business prospects and industrialization, charters Amy, an elderly Tiger Moth, to take him to the industrially important areas of the State.
results.description: A promotional film for industrial development in Queensland. A Canadian, visiting Queensland to report on business prospects and industrialization, charters Amy, an elderly Tiger Moth, to take him to the industrially important areas of the State.

results.title: Amphibians
results.brief_description: Presents the life cycles, habits and general characteristics of amphibians - frogs, toads, and salamanders. Points out characteristics shared by these three creatures and how they differ. Explains the changes which occur during metamorphosis; feeding habits; hibernation; cold-bloodedness, skin and skeletal characteristics. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Among fish
results.creator_credit: Kenneth McCready, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A demonstration, for junior science classes, of what fish are, how they live, breathe, swim and, more remarkable, how they float up or down by manipulating their air bladder. The fish shown in the film are of the kind native to Canada’s lakes and streams, but others, of the tropical variety, are observed in the miniature marine world of a classroom aquarium. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Amoeba
results.brief_description: This one-celled organism has been photographed as a solid object and not, as diagrammatic represent- ations suggest, a flat object in one plane. The production of pseudopods is shown - the amoeba pursuing and capturing its prey and ingesting living organisms

results.title: An American time capsule
results.creator_credit: Charles Braverman, Braverman Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Condenses 200 years of American history into three volatile minutes. The film is a chronological capsule of 1,300 visuals (paintings, still photographs, newspaper headlines, early newsreels, posters and political cartoons). No commentary - music “Beat that drum” by Sandy Nelson.

results.title: The American super 8 revolution
results.brief_description: Stan Woodward offers us two films in one. - his documentation of the production of a super-8mm film by a group of fifth graders as well as their finished product.

results.title: American square dance
results.brief_description: Couples demonstrate the meaning of the following square dance terms: honour your partner, honour your corner, swing, allemande left, grand right and left, promenade, go visiting, right and left back, two ladies change, change right back, right and left through, four hands up and away we go, half way round and a do-si-do, all drops hands. The dance “Take a little peep” is demonstrated.
results.description: Couples demonstrate the meaning of the following square dance terms: honour your partner, honour your corner, swing, allemande left, grand right and left, promenade, go visiting, right and left back, two ladies change, change right back, right and left through, four hands up and away we go, half way round and a do-si-do, all drops hands. The dance “Take a little peep” is demonstrated.

results.title: The American road
results.brief_description: Produced to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Ford Motor Company, this film traces the development of American highways over the last 50 years. It tells the story of man’s method of transportation and how it has influenced his life, business, health and recreation. Includes archival footage of the early days of Henry Ford’s factory, such as the creation of the first assembly line.

results.title: The American revolution
results.brief_description: Portrays highlights of the American Revolution from the Boston Tea Party to the surrender of Cornwallis to Washington at Yorktown. Includes scenes depicting the battles of Lexington and Concord, the attack on Fort Ticonderoga and the campaigns led by General Washington. No other credits available.

results.title: American music: from folk to jazz and pop
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Donald, Stephen Fleischman and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Looks at the “musical explosion” by tracing the roots of popular music or jazz in American history. Studies the African and European roots in New Orleans jazz and gospel songs in hillbilly folk songs and dances, showing many of the actual oletime as well as recent performers who gave American popular music its first expression, and developed it into the internationally recognised jazz of today.
